summary:
# Daily AI Newsletter Digest - 10/11/2025

## üî• Top Stories
- AI expert Charlie Hills shares his strategy for winning on LinkedIn by focusing on experience-led content, emphasizing the importance of specificity, scarcity, proof, and trust in a world where AI can easily generate generic content.
- Meta invests $25 billion in its AI empire, demonstrating the company's commitment to developing its AI capabilities.
- Researchers from Tokyo Metropolitan University propose a novel approach to onboard anomaly detection and identification for satellites using the Mahalanobis distance, aiming to improve satellite robustness without requiring exhaustive failure-mode codification.

## ü§ñ AI Models & Research
- A beginner's guide to AI model types highlights the importance of understanding different models, including transformers, recurrent neural networks (RNNs), and generative adversarial networks (GANs).
- Researchers propose a novel approach to onboard anomaly detection and identification for satellites using the Mahalanobis distance, which models normal telemetry signal relationships and measures deviations from this baseline.
- A study on UX patterns in generative AI experiences discusses the evolution of graphical user interfaces (GUIs) and how they can inform UX patterns in generative AI experiences.

## üõ†Ô∏è Tools & Products
- Google updates AI Studio with a "vibe coding" system, allowing users to build apps in minutes without writing code.
- Adobe rolls out new AI assistants for Express and Photoshop, improving the creative workflow for users.
- PayPal allows users to shop inside ChatGPT, enabling seamless purchases within the AI chat platform.
- A 42-page work guide by Perplexity promises to replace ChatGPT, Google, and other tools, and has been tested by Adham Khaled with positive results.

## üì∞ Industry News
- Bloomsbury's CEO suggests that AI could help writers beat writer's block and improve their writing skills.
- The AI Automation Society announces its October MVPs and releases new videos on YouTube, covering topics such as building an inbox agent, sales automation, and making $231,000 in 30 days as an AI consultant.
- Meta's significant investment in AI demonstrates the company's commitment to developing its AI capabilities.

## üìö Resources & Learning
- A guide on how to use ChatGPT for better results provides tips on using the tool for research, writing, and problem-solving.
- An article on building dashboards that don't suck provides tips on designing dashboards that guide users and make data more understandable.
- Six Python libraries are highlighted as being able to instantly upgrade projects, including libraries for data science, machine learning, and web development.

newsletters.subject: Weekly digest for Sun, Oct 26 2025
newsletters.summary:
## Weekly Digest for Sun, Oct 26 2025

### Key Highlights
- The AI Automation Society announced the October MVPs, with the top 5 members being recognized for their contributions.
- Nate Herk shared his experience of building an AI agent in just 2 hours and earning $1200 from it.
- A Halloween giveaway was conducted, where two free n8n Cloud Starter Plans were given away to lucky members.
- New videos were released on YouTube, covering topics such as building an inbox agent, sales automation, and making $231,000 in 30 days as an AI consultant.
- Titus Blair initiated discussions on finding members in the same industry/profession and sharing geographical locations.

### Detailed Points
- The AI Automation Society announced the top 5 members of the month for October, recognizing their contributions to the community.
- Nate Herk shared a post about building an AI agent in 2 hours and earning $1200 from it, inspiring others to create and sell their own AI agents.
- A Halloween giveaway was conducted, where two free n8n Cloud Starter Plans ($240 value each) were given away to lucky members, @Dudley Wise and another winner.
- Nate Herk released new videos on YouTube, including:
  * "From Zero to Inbox Agent (Full Beginner's Course, No-Code)" - a step-by-step tutorial on building an AI agent in n8n.
  * "This n8n Sales Automation Won $5,000 in Just 14 days" - an interview with Brett, the winner of the September AIS+ Hackathon.
  * "How I made $231,000 in 30 days (as an AI Consultant)" - a video sharing Nate Herk's experience and strategies for making a significant income as an AI consultant.
- Titus Blair initiated discussions on finding members in the same industry/profession and sharing geographical locations to facilitate networking and collaboration.
- Members were encouraged to participate in discussions and share their own experiences and knowledge.

- Change notification settings: https://link.skool.com/ls/click?upn=u001.wK6x93jhdVos-2F3TofGJCJqYIach7-2FtMhH3n-2Fh9qG9l1PI-2Fm-2BraVkdOOdLOhb-2F-2B9kC6CS8L3GE-2B2twtfU-2FANqqw-3D-3DL_eD_dhmFokmJdYhJ7cOq2uAxQbs-2FJ9rdv-2B8XUdt4bEaaXnETGAW5pCoxqmB9U4HcUgw2rMjZxvjxnbjAV5SYhtKGPOawzTOgbcMwpDkKiKwnktEAahY37BUjobiLxfomdIC5uDlxINi1YudWepxkSR5haYSJHiMHeQQ-2BrLQfjsyjHjt9Bf8-2Bn60lGgXLSP2NgiCJKMH4vezNKcQrC2fCS-2B2eWhhjbVOFAHgLnZusxmI4bE6jZOY-2FAOibhzghHKnsGouUsvyhyLYjn8r-2FzurLHrS1YfX5mAcwLgWtfrSTuaW6scJWZ-2FaxMANBtgWXzrz8IpTkV0-2Fq6aT8wEDfRzt8Sp-2FGSSGPkUqaJNl557haW6stfEEb0GFdpM80DacN0qitQplM-2FQyDbf79QahgO6uDnGm9fwPLzB75uHlteDAwiSm-2B3UfjX4rMmOvrsaUEY3opcGUOPLhrhH7GBCNENHnUZMZNAbF0ZZ5a5bTmp9eP7kuiSsm1NXOZAA8LjoOnaeVjNTpJUobhHQme1qEyRCdmzin94Q-3D-3D

newsletters.subject: Not Everything Is an LLM: 8 AI Model Types You Need to Know in 2025 | Pasindu Rangana in Mr. Plan ‚Çø Publication
newsletters.summary:
## Medium Daily Digest

### Key Highlights
- The newsletter covers various topics in AI, technology, and programming, including a beginner's guide to AI model types, testing Perplexity's secret work guide, and using ChatGPT for better results.
- It also features articles on Python libraries, UX patterns in generative AI experiences, and building dashboards that don't suck.

### Detailed Points
- **AI Model Types**: Pasindu Rangana's article "Not Everything Is an LLM: 8 AI Model Types You Need to Know in 2025" provides a beginner's guide to AI model types, highlighting that not everything is a Large Language Model (LLM). The article discusses 8 AI model types, including transformers, recurrent neural networks (RNNs), and generative adversarial networks (GANs).
- **Perplexity's Secret Work Guide**: Adham Khaled's article "I Spent 40 Hours Testing Perplexity‚Äôs Secret 42-Page Work Guide" shares his experience testing Perplexity's secret work guide, which promises to replace ChatGPT, Google, and other tools. The guide is a 42-page playbook that helps users create content, answer questions, and more.
- **ChatGPT**: Scott H. Young's article "10 Best Ways To Use ChatGPT (With Examples)" provides tips on how to use ChatGPT for better results, including using it for research, writing, and problem-solving.
- **Python Libraries**: Abdur Rahman's article "6 Python Libraries That Instantly Upgrade Your Projects" highlights six Python libraries that can upgrade projects, including libraries for data science, machine learning, and web development.
- **UX Patterns in Generative AI Experiences**: Ryan Tang's article "Emerging UX patterns in Generative AI experiences" discusses the evolution of graphical user interfaces (GUIs) and how they can inform UX patterns in generative AI experiences.
- **Building Dashboards**: Hamza Boulahia's article "Start Making Dashboards That Don‚Äôt Suck!" provides tips on how to design dashboards that guide users and make data more understandable.

### Important Links
- **Not Everything Is an LLM: 8 AI Model Types You Need to Know in 2025**: https://medium.com/@pasindur/not-everything-is-an-llm-8-ai-model-types-you-need-to-know-in-2025-6fb026bcdc82
- **I Spent 40 Hours Testing Perplexity‚Äôs Secret 42-Page Work Guide**: https://medium.com/@adhamhidawy/i-spent-40-hours-testing-perplexitys-secret-42-page-work-guide-5c5bcdab8558
- **10 Best Ways To Use ChatGPT (With Examples)**: https://medium.com/@scotthyoung/10-best-ways-to-use-chatgpt-with-examples-f2e5ba86de38
- **6 Python Libraries That Instantly Upgrade Your Projects**: https://medium.com/@abdur.rahman12/6-python-libraries-that-instantly-upgrade-your-projects-b0481165b85b
- **Emerging UX patterns in Generative AI experiences**: https://medium.com/@ryantang/emerging-interaction-patterns-in-generative-ai-experiences-8c351bb3392a
- **Start Making Dashboards That Don‚Äôt Suck!**: https://medium.com/@hamzamlwh/start-making-dashboards-that-dont-suck-87e7474d5572

newsletters.subject: Toward an Onboard Anomaly Detection and Identification Method for Satellites
newsletters.summary:
## JournalClub.io Newsletter

### Key Highlights
- Researchers from Tokyo Metropolitan University, Japan, have proposed a novel approach to onboard anomaly detection and identification for satellites using the Mahalanobis distance.
- The method aims to improve satellite robustness without requiring exhaustive failure-mode codification.
- The system works in three phases: feature extraction, anomaly detection, and anomaly identification.

### Detailed Points
- The traditional approach to anomaly detection in satellites relies on out-of-limit checks, which can only catch predicted failures.
- The proposed method models normal telemetry signal relationships and measures deviations from this baseline using the Mahalanobis distance.
- The system extracts five feature types for each of the five anomaly categories: outliers, offsets, amplitudes, waveforms, and periodic anomalies.
- The features are computed over sliding windows, and the system uses a two-level hierarchy to reduce channel-level features to type-level scores and then to a single overall anomaly score.
- Anomaly identification uses orthogonal arrays and signal-to-noise ratios to determine the primary cause of the detected anomaly and the specific abnormal channel.
- The system was tested on NASA's SMAP dataset and the CATS dataset, achieving high precision and moderate recall balance.
- The system can run on a Raspberry Pi Zero, demonstrating its potential for onboard implementation.

### Important Links
- **Watch or Listen to the Episode**: [Link to the episode](https://journalclub.io/episodes/toward-an-onboard-anomaly-detection-and-identification-method-for-satellites?token=mVW43SJwbHSInYUFXcNCaQHt1NDntAXyyhtv3kuelhhJ1BBMlA)
- **Read the Original Paper**: [Link to the paper](https://journalclub.io/track/4OxmImzjAXJO5P4MzlSNOhUTz6gsa2vSjUFLhI4eHz7PlvfilA)
- **JournalClub.io**: [Link to the website](https://journalclub.io/)
- **Twitter**: [Link to the Twitter page](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=https://journalclub.io/track/c1ddAGjnFRDnUTFSJnEoM0QkoJU3L0twXlk2x5AEYU7DtcqPjl)
- **LinkedIn**: [Link to the LinkedIn page](https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https://journalclub.io/track/hJorzvDgBibmsapCIc0ZmtRdMD9CBJE4rg4ndTtZKMfLtP5lkk&title=&summary=&source=)
newsletters.originalContent:
Toward an Onboard Anomaly Detection and Identification Method for Satellites   

Once a satellite goes up, that‚Äôs it. Either it works, or it doesn‚Äôt. There‚Äôs no second chance, no service call, no way to patch things later. These machines have to operate nearly flawlessly in one of the harshest environments imaginable: an environment that‚Äôs actively trying to destroy them. There‚Äôs radiation that can fry electronics, there are temperature swings that can warp metal, crack joints, and throw sensors out of calibration.

![](https://journalclub.io/px/fHND4j4qJqRDUXPfRqLvZ3zj25gkelQAvMpoldv4CrUBc0uJhu)

Toward an Onboard Anomaly Detection and Identification Method for Satellites

JournalClub.io, November 2nd 2025  
  

[![Thumbnail of today's episode.](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/kV6UhiTBmv01R11rJTOg)](https://journalclub.io/episodes/toward-an-onboard-anomaly-detection-and-identification-method-for-satellites?token=mVW43SJwbHSInYUFXcNCaQHt1NDntAXyyhtv3kuelhhJ1BBMlA)

newsletters.subject: One creator used AI for hypergrowth
newsletters.summary:
## Mindstream

### Key Highlights
- AI expert Charlie Hills shares how he uses AI to win on LinkedIn by focusing on experience-led content, which he believes is the key to success in a world where generic content is easily generated by AI.
- Google has given AI Studio a "vibe coding" update, allowing users to build apps in minutes with a new visual coding system.
- Bloomsbury's CEO says AI could help writers beat writer's block and improve their writing skills.
- PayPal is allowing users to shop inside ChatGPT, enabling seamless purchases within the AI chat platform.
- Adobe has rolled out new AI assistants for Express and Photoshop, improving the creative workflow for users.
- Meta is borrowing $25 billion to fund its AI empire, a significant investment in the company's AI capabilities.

### Detailed Points
- Charlie Hills emphasizes the importance of experience-led content, which is specific, grounded, and earned, in a world where AI can easily generate generic content.
- He provides a framework for creating experience-led content, which includes specificity, scarcity, proof, and trust.
- Hills also shares his process for building a story bank, which involves creating a Google Doc to store milestone achievements and then using ChatGPT to generate content based on that archive.
- Google's AI Studio update introduces a visual coding system that allows users to build apps in minutes without writing code.
- Bloomsbury's CEO suggests that AI can help writers overcome writer's block and improve their writing skills.
- PayPal's integration with ChatGPT enables users to shop within the AI chat platform, streamlining the purchasing process.
- Adobe's new AI assistants for Express and Photoshop aim to improve the creative workflow for users.
- Meta's significant investment in AI demonstrates the company's commitment to developing its AI capabilities.
